Articles.Content: Mechjeb doesn't appear to be functional in 1.1.3. Does anyone know if it will be updated any time in the future? Until then, I'm not updating.

normally the dev version would be faster, today's update doesn'T mention 1.1.3 though
https://ksp.sarbian.com/jenkins/job/MechJeb2-Dev/
I'm encountering this also...guess I will give it some time!
The dev sleeps at 3 in the morning. How lazy of him...

15 minutes ago, sarbian said:

The dev sleeps at 3 in the morning. How lazy of him...

Take him off the payroll

I lold at the 3 AM joke but seriously. It's been out 9 hours now. I'm sure like most of the people here including the Mechjeb author lives in the US. It could be as late as 4:30 AM assuming the guy/girl lives in the eastern time zone. Even if he doesn't live in the US but somewhere where it's mid day now, the guy/gal is probably at his job.
How can you even consider anybody knowing when it will be updated considering these conditions. 
Had you expressed your dear wish for a soon update without asking for a timespan, ok fine.
But this is just cruel!
All I can say, my expectations about Mechjeb is that the author usually updates it within 1 to several days after a new KSP edition.

In the meanwhile you can use KER for your Dv readouts.

It's already been updated and released for 1.1.3. In just 9 hours after an official KSP update. Official post

(I'd rather leave the origin of this topic without comment.)

Super awesome! Now that's fast.
@small text.

Wise not to comment, maybe I shouldn't. It just annoys me why people even dare to ask it so soon. That it so happens to update in such a short notice just proves the dedication of the author, and serves anybody ASAP. Didn't even expect it this soon, kinda had hoped everybody would atleast wait a single day before opening a new thread about "asking for a update"

 

Edited June 22, 2016 by Vaporized Steel

The mechjeb author is me and I live in Europe. The US is not the center of the world....

Hey

I also live in europe.
And I don't think the US is the centre of the world.
All I'm saying is that most seem to live in the US and those that don't are likely to have a job. Great you updated it so soon.
1.13 Release seems to be working fine with normal, but workable known issues. Thanks Sarbian !

As this topic has served its purpose, I'm closing it.
